item.title: One of the Most Blatant Pokémon Rip-Offs Can Now Be Wishlisted on Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/one-of-the-most-blatant-pokemon-rip-offs-can-now-be-wishlisted-on-steam/

One of the most blatant Pokémon rip-offs is now available to be wishlisted on Steam. Insider Gaming was recently contacted by the developers behind “Fay Keeper,” a brand-new creature-catching game where players collect and battle hundreds of creatures called “Fays.” The request was for a paid partnership – and in the current game industry climate it’s an opportunity that comes few and far between.

Yet, having looked at the game initially, we couldn’t help but feel inclined that the game is a blatant rip-off of Pokémon.

From the color pallet to the creatures themselves, the comparisons are strikingly similar, and although it’s clear that the developers want to capitalize on an itching Pokémon audience on the PC, I can’t help but feel the team is likely going to run into legal issues. You even get your very own “Faydex.”

Insider Gaming compiled a couple comparisons between Fay Keeper and Pokémon below (click to enlarge) so you can muster your own opinions.

For what it’s worth, the developers of the game have addressed them slightly on social media when asked by fans about the comparisons to Pokémon. BGS Studios doesn’t hide the fact that it takes inspiration from the classic franchise, but maintains that there will be enough differences between the titles to avoid any potential legal claims.

“Pokémon was a huge ref and the idea was for it to feel nostalgic, but me and the team are working on a lot of unique features that Pokémon games never had,” one post reads.

In another response to a question regarding copyright, BGS Studios said, “Although we took inspiration from a very nostalgic reference, every single pixel and line of code is being made from scratch by us. We’ll also have mechanics that were never in the original ref, so it will hit close while also being a different thing.”

Insider Gaming did reach out to BGS Studios for further comment on the similarities, and to talk about any potential worries or concerns. Those attempts, however, have gone unanswered as of publishing.

What do you think of the similarities between Fay Keeper and Pokémon? Do you think this could lead to problems down the road? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what game was just cancelled with layoffs happening at the studio. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Donkey Kong Country Returns Switch Release Date
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/donkey-kong-country-returns-switch-release-date/

Donkey Kong and his pal Diddy are two of Nintendo’s longest-serving mascots. The duo is due to hit screens again in Donkey Kong Country Returns HD, and the release date is close.

Nintendo has decided to halt production of new Donkey Kong for now games in favor of ports. Donkey Kong: Tropical Freeze was released 11 years ago now—representing the most recent “new” DK game. It was ported to Switch in 2018, and Nintendo has decided to go even further back and port Donkey Kong: Country Returns to Switch as well.

I’m not sure if this is a case of the Switch being at the end of its lifecycle ahead of the Nintendo Switch 2. Regardless, it never hurts to see Donkey Kong again! The big, lumbering mammoth of a monkey is here, and Country Returns on the Switch likewise.

When is the Donkey Kong Country Returns Switch Release Date?

The Donkey Kong Country Returns release date for Nintendo Switch is January 16.

Yep, get your fingers out and start counting. The HD port of Country Returns is gearing up to grace the Switch mere days from now. I’d say it looked pretty decent back in the day on the Wii, but a 2024 Switch release is worlds apart.

It’s also getting extra levels featured in the 3DS port, along with all the original features:

  • Over 80+ levels
  • 9 Worlds
  • Boss Battles
  • Lots of collectibles
  • Time Attack levels
  • Local co-op

Donkey Kong Country Returns Switch Release Time

We expect Donkey Kong Country Returns on Switch to release at midnight everywhere.

If games get a special release time, it’s usually announced ahead of launch. So far, we haven’t seen anything to suggest otherwise, so a midnight launch in your region is probably likely. Different timezones get to play Country Returns HD first—something I suffer from being in the UK—and DK fans will be going bananas for release day.

All Donkey Kong Country Returns Switch Platforms

Yep, Nintendo Switch is the only platform Donkey Kong Country Returns HD is coming to.

Not too much to add here if you don’t already know. Donkey Kong is one of Nintendo’s most cherished brands and lives on its consoles. You can play Country Returns on Wii and 3Ds, but the spruced-up, all-encompassing port is exclusive to the Nintendo Switch.

Donkey Kong Country Returns HD is one of several games being released in January 2025. It’s a fairly quiet month, but the biggest Nintendo games coming out in 2025 are sure to shake the foundations a bit.

Let us know if you are picking up a copy of Donkey Kong Country Returns HD on Switch. Plus, what do you think, is it time for Nintendo to pull their finger out and announce a new Donkey Kong entry?

item.title: Xbox Developer Direct Announced for January 23
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-developer-direct-announced-for-january-23/

Xbox’s upcoming Developer Direct has been announced. It will arrive on January 23 at 10 am Pacific / 1 pm Eastern / 6 pm UK. 

This year’s Xbox Developer Direct will provide players with a detailed look at the games they have to offer for Xbox Series X/S, PC and Game Pass in 2025. Developers such as Compulsion Games, Sandfall Interactive and id Studios will join the fray to reveal more information about South of Midnight, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and DOOM: The Dark Ages, respectively.

How to Watch Xbox Developer Direct 2025?

Xbox Developer Direct 2025 will be live-streamed across all Xbox social channels on January 23 at 10 am PT / 1 pm ET / 6 pm UK. 

  • Youtube
  • Twitch

What to Expect from Xbox Developer Direct 2025

Doom: The Dark Ages

iD studio will finally give players a full reveal for Doom: The Dark Ages. The upcoming title is a prequel to the original series and will become the franchise’s third instalment. 

South of Midnight

Compulsion Games will provide a glimpse into their upcoming third-person action-adventure, South of Midnight. The title is set in the American Deep South, where you encounter creatures inspired by Southern Folklore. 

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 

Lastly, Sandfall Interactive will discuss how Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was created with some behind-the-scenes details and “how they plan to deliver an incredible story in a gorgeous fantasy world.”

Surprise Game

Xbox also has a secret game up their sleeves, and they will be visiting “a surprise location to see another studio’s brand new game”.

In other news, Microsoft will combine ‘Xbox and Windows’ to enhance their handheld experience. Also, check out the Game Pass titles for this month. What are your thoughts on this year’s Xbox Developer Direct? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Sony’s new future immersive The Last of Us concept project. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
